intro: Pennisetum giganteum var. minus, commonly known as fountain grass, is a perennial grass native to Africa. It features slender, arching stems that produce fluffy, feathery plumes, giving it a distinctive, ornamental appearance. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically blue-green in color, though they may turn reddish in cooler temperatures. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ability to attract birds and butterflies adds ecological value to the environment.
